newsitem.title: UK: Natwest says Natwest Markets not for sale.
newsitem.headline: Natwest says Natwest Markets not for sale.

text.p: Britain's National Westminster Bank said on Tuesday its recently-shrunk NatWest Markets investment banking unit was not for sale.
Asked if he intended to sell the operation, NatWest chief executive Derek Wanless told Reuters: "No way, it's not up for sale."

Wanless also denied that the reorganisation of the Markets unit was just a cosmetic exercise. He said it was important to remember that 10 billion stg of capital would be removed from the area over two years.
Wanless said the capital would either be used in the rest of the business or, if found to be surplus, returned to shareholders. -- Joe Ortiz, London Newsroom +44 171 542 8864.
